tweet: Today is Gold Star Mother’s Day! Let’s honor and remember all our Gold Star Mothers and their heroic sons and daughters who served our nation and gave the ultimate sacrifice on our behalf. God bless you all.

This week, I spoke at the @HouseCommerce subcommittee hearing on the public health threats of E-Cigarettes. The trends we are seeing surrounding this issue are concerning, but there is also a lot left to learn. More here: https://bit.ly/2natLDJ

The trade deal made between Japan & the U.S. is a win for Oregon farmers & ranchers. It is expected to have a significant benefit for Oregon wheat, wine, potatoes, & beef.  This deal will help level the playing field for American agriculture. https://walden.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/greg-walden-trade-deal-welcome-news-oregon-s-farmers-and-ranchers …
… Americans deserve to get all of the facts - including seeing both the report from the whistleblower and the transcripts of the conversations former Vice President Joe Biden has had.

I’ve now read the transcript of the phone conversation between President Trump and President Zelensky, and while it wasn’t President Trump’s finest moment, from what I’ve seen so far it certainly does not rise to ‘high crimes and misdemeanors’...

20 veterans die by suicide a day – a rate that veterans in Oregon face at twice the national average. We all need to #bethere for our nation’s heroes. I encourage you to visit  http://www.bethereforveterans.com  to learn more. #SuicidePreventionMonth @HouseVetAffairs @DeptVetAffairs pic.twitter.com/P5GBQsOsuP

I recently published an op-ed in Modern Healthcare on the opioid epidemic. It highlights both the historic achievements we’ve already made and the continued work that needs to be done to combat the #opioidcrisis. Read it here: https://walden.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/greg-walden-we-re-making-progress-battle-defeat-opioid-epidemic-far-over?fbclid=IwAR0Z29p1sz5B2kxn1x03Dy11UDWpGTMbTRxZ4wbWaSejnCsVtuLys19-yCM …

47.8 billion - that is how many robocalls Americans received last year. As the Republican Leader of @HouseCommerce, I am working hard to put an end to these pesky calls. The House already passed the Stopping Bad Robocalls Act - now it's the Senate's turn. https://bit.ly/2kyAypA

I can think of no better way to spend a Friday afternoon than welcoming home southern Oregon WWII, Korean War, and Vietnam War Veterans! Thank you for your service patriots. I hope you enjoy the rest of your time in D.C.  @HouseVetAffairs pic.twitter.com/EUV67gJCIe

Today, we remember all the brave men and women who were prisoners of war and those who have yet to return home. Let us never forget these patriotic men and women, may their sacrifice be forever remembered. #POWMIARecognitionDay pic.twitter.com/S7F31GZR1N

Today, @FrankPallone & I launched a bipartisan investigation into private equity practices around surprise billing. Surprise billing is on the rise in the U.S. and it is time to put an end to this practice. https://walden.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/greg-walden-launches-bipartisan-investigation-private-equity-firms-role …

Today, @EPA announced they have repealed the Obama-era rules concerning WOTUS. Farmers and ranchers across Oregon have expressed their concerns with the overreaching Obama-era definition of WOTUS. Thank you @POTUS for listening to our farmers & ranchers. https://walden.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/greg-walden-statement-epa-s-revision-wotus …

It’s past time to get accurate broadband mapping data. Take the community of Weston in eastern OR as an example. Mayor Spurgeon describes their internet service as dial up, just w/out the modem noise, but the FCC map claims they have 100-megabit service. https://bit.ly/2kJh5m9

This morning, I had the chance to visit @Wawa and celebrate @NACSonline’s 100th In-Store event with @PeterWelch and @PaulTonko. We spoke with employees and discussed the convenience store industry. #NACSinstore pic.twitter.com/QZBx5LboOV

We must never forget what happened on September 11th, and we must double down on our efforts to make sure it never happens again. God bless our first responders, our active duty men and women, and the veterans who have served this country. (4/4)
There was a lot of loss of life that day. Our hearts and prayers go out to those who survived, and the families of the victims and certainly to our first responders. (3/4)
As we were beginning the news conference, an officer on a motorcycle drove by right here, stopped, saw us, and said 'get out of here, they just hit the Pentagon!' and pointed to the sky. (2/4)

September 11th. We all remember where we were, what we were doing, where our family was. For me, it was right here on the House Triangle. We were about to do a news conference on an issue affecting the west. The Capitol is obviously right behind me. (1/4) pic.twitter.com/imyeVRIAyx

Connecting Americans to high speed broadband, especially in rural areas, is the goal of our hearing on broadband mapping that’s underway in the Energy and Commerce Committee. pic.twitter.com/F4LDWtgoZm

Josephine County is now a HIDTA-listed county. This gives me hope that we will see greater success in combating the foreign cartels & the drug trafficking throughout our state. This program has already produced successful results throughout Oregon. https://walden.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/greg-walden-statement-josephine-countys-hidta-status …

Today, @HouseCommerce held a hearing on maternal health. Despite innovation in health care, recent reports have indicated the number of women dying due to pregnancy complications has increased in recent years. Listen to my full remarks on the topic here:  https://bit.ly/2kFZpIf  pic.twitter.com/PRByrRx1Zn

Thanks to our servicemembers, we are blessed with great freedoms, like the freedom to assemble and the freedom of speech. We might disagree w/ fellow Americans on various issues, but I think we can all agree that it is great to live in a free country. https://bit.ly/2lNfNXq

This year, I have held 40 town halls - more than any other member of the Oregon Congressional Delegation and more than most members of the House of Representatives. Traveling the district to hear from Oregonians is one of the best, and perhaps most important, parts of my job! pic.twitter.com/wKlr45GU6G

This week is Opioid Crisis Awareness Week. This deadly epidemic has touched every corner of our great nation and combating it will require everyone. I encourage you to join me in working to stop this crisis & raise awareness. Together we will continue to  make a difference. pic.twitter.com/4NUMmzqTnc

I am glad to announce the @FCC has awarded $67.6 million to expand rural broadband in Oregon. I look forward to continuing to work alongside Chairman @AjitPaiFCC and my colleagues in Congress to ensure all Americans are connected to high speed broadband.
